titleStmt.title: David Duncan et al to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG12150

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.collection: 1st - 20th Regiments Kentucky Infantry Primary Source Documents

body.p:
Camp 17th Ky vols Inft
Near Atlanta Ga
August 22nd 1864
Govenor Bramlette,
Honorable Sir:

As there is a great difference of opinion here in regard to the mustering out of Troops. The question is whether or not Troops are mustered out from date of enlistment. the organization of the Regt or their muster in to the Service We ask your decision on this Subject,
By so doing you will oblige many Soldiers.

We are Very Respectfully
Your Obt Servtts
David Duncan
Capt Co "C" 17th Ky Vols
Saml, T, Fruit
Capt Co G 17th Ky vol
Linus Fuller
Lieut Co "C" 17th Ky
Curtis ,,A,, Brasher
2nd Lieut Co "C" 17th Ky

17
Camp 17th Ky. Infty.
Near Atlanta Ga.
Aug. 22nd 64
Duncan. David
Capt. Co. "C". and others.
To Governor.
Stating there is Difference of opinion about the muster-out of Reg'ts. Desires to Know the Gov's opinion as to where Reg'ts are mustd out.

L. B. no 6 -- 1864. P 174
Recd A G.O. 30th Aug. 1864.
